commit_message:
Additional small changes in role/mariadb

 - Replace hardcoded haproxy monitor user with variable.
 - Rename mariadb_backup variable to mariadb_backup_possible.
 - Drop creation of monitor user in handlers as this is
   now handled in register.yml for good reason.

Change-Id: I255a79d36ae18ca42d0befd00b235ca509197db3

messages: [{'account_id': 6773, 'date': '2021-03-30 08:15:20.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 6773, 'date': '2021-04-06 08:21:40.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:\n\nrecheck'}, {'account_id': 7144, 'date': '2021-04-12 20:19:37.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2'}, {'account_id': 6681, 'date': '2021-04-14 12:16:29.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2 Workflow+1'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2021-03-30 08:15:20.000000000', 'message': '[OVN] Remove check for OVN + Availability Zones

The ML2/OVN driver does support AZ-aware routing scheduling from
stable/train and newer versions.

This patch also removes the check from the DHCP agent container because
although not a typical deployment, the Neutron DHCP agent can be
deployed with OVN for special cases such as baremetal provisioning where
the agent would serve DHCP to the baremetal instances.

Change-Id: I8941c4d9a8e68eb775c910495de4aff9fbc67206
Signed-off-by: Lucas Alvares Gomes <lucasagomes@gmail.com>
(cherry picked from commit 9283e44d16214f148e04a66d248514b170dad07f)
'}]
commit_message:
[OVN] Remove check for OVN + Availability Zones

The ML2/OVN driver does support AZ-aware routing scheduling from
stable/train and newer versions.

This patch also removes the check from the DHCP agent container because
although not a typical deployment, the Neutron DHCP agent can be
deployed with OVN for special cases such as baremetal provisioning where
the agent would serve DHCP to the baremetal instances.

Change-Id: I8941c4d9a8e68eb775c910495de4aff9fbc67206
Signed-off-by: Lucas Alvares Gomes <lucasagomes@gmail.com>
(cherry picked from commit 9283e44d16214f148e04a66d248514b170dad07f)

commit_message:
OVN mac address ports ansible module

Add ansible module tripleo_ovn_mac_addresses. This
module will replace the following tripleo-heat-templates
resources:
  OS::TripleO::OVNMacAddressNetwork
  OS::TripleO::OVNMacAddressPort

Also update the tripleo_hieradata 'ovn_chassis_mac_map.j2'
template.

Implements: blueprint network-data-v2-ports
Change-Id: I0bc9c180b6a6cb70d32005e9528cf1b16c861ea8

commit_message:
Add ExternalDNSOverQuota exception

When floating IP is created and the overquota limit of the external
dns service (e.g. designate) exceeds, recordset creation fails. Report
correct error/exception in neutron instead of HttpException.

Related-Bug: #1923700
Change-Id: I030d4c1db0dfb8f0a242cb60d641d7ed05ee8051

commit_message:
Add support for heat_api_{cfn_,}uwsgi_config in Debian

This patch is adding the configuration of the number of workers,
threads, and the size of the listen queue in Debian, which uses
uwsgi to run Heat API and api-metadata. Therefore, this patch adds
two new heat_api_uwsgi_config and heat_api_cfn_uwsgi_config
providers as well as two new heat::wsgi::uwsgi_api and
heat::wsgi::uwsgi_api_cfn classes.

Change-Id: I0e226046f6e2d69c89681948cee8e8830c186489

revisions:
[{'created': '2021-04-09 15:41:21.000000000', 'message': "[WIP] adjust Prometheus readiness probe path from /status to /-/ready

Prometheus documentation shows that /-/ready can be used to check that
it is ready to service traffic (i.e. response to queries). [0] I suspect
there are some cases where Prometheus may turn Ready in k8s before it's
actually ready to serve traffic (using /status).

[0]: https://prometheus.io/docs/prometheus/latest/management_api/

Change-Id: Iab22d0c986d680663fbe8e84d6c0d89b03dc6428

"}, {'created': '2021-04-13 15:23:58.000000000', 'message': "Adjust Prometheus http readiness probe path from /status to /-/ready

Prometheus documentation shows that /-/ready can be used to check that
it is ready to service traffic (i.e. respond to queries) [0]. I've
witnessed cases where Prometheus's readiness probe is passing during
initial deployment using /status, which in turn triggers its helm test
to start. Said helm test then fails because /status is not a good a
reliable indicator that Prometheus is actually ready to serve traffic
and the helm test is performing actions that require it to be proprely
up and ready.

[0]: https://prometheus.io/docs/prometheus/latest/management_api/

Change-Id: Iab22d0c986d680663fbe8e84d6c0d89b03dc6428

commit_message:
Adjust Prometheus http readiness probe path from /status to /-/ready

Prometheus documentation shows that /-/ready can be used to check that
it is ready to service traffic (i.e. respond to queries) [0]. I've
witnessed cases where Prometheus's readiness probe is passing during
initial deployment using /status, which in turn triggers its helm test
to start. Said helm test then fails because /status is not a good a
reliable indicator that Prometheus is actually ready to serve traffic
and the helm test is performing actions that require it to be proprely
up and ready.

[0]: https://prometheus.io/docs/prometheus/latest/management_api/

Change-Id: Iab22d0c986d680663fbe8e84d6c0d89b03dc6428

commit_message:
docs: Document options for remaining nova-* commands

Most of these share the same collection of oslo.config and oslo.log
options so it makes sense to group them together. The only exception is
nova-rootwrap, which is a wrapper around the 'oslo_rootwrap.cmd.main'
module, which curiously does not use argparse and doesn't have any
options.

Change-Id: I393ff162be58700956fbab29ff6b9ba3cf5860a6
Signed-off-by: Stephen Finucane <stephenfin@redhat.com>

revisions:
[{'created': '2021-03-16 15:01:23.000000000', 'message': "Schedule networks to new segments if needed

In case when subnet in segment X was created before hosts from
that segment was mapped in the Neutron DB, network wasn't scheduled
to the DHCP agents in that new segment.
Now DHCP scheduler is triggered in such case.

Closes-bug: #1917811
Change-Id: Ic9e64aa4ecdc3d56f00c26204ad931b810db7599
(cherry picked from commit 5c931f29132c3c5c01127f089f7d5909d2a19e4d)
"}]
commit_message:
Schedule networks to new segments if needed

In case when subnet in segment X was created before hosts from
that segment was mapped in the Neutron DB, network wasn't scheduled
to the DHCP agents in that new segment.
Now DHCP scheduler is triggered in such case.

Closes-bug: #1917811
Change-Id: Ic9e64aa4ecdc3d56f00c26204ad931b810db7599
(cherry picked from commit 5c931f29132c3c5c01127f089f7d5909d2a19e4d)

hey Marcin, should we drop it? (due to no maintenance, rather than the original reason here)'}, {'account_id': 24072, 'date': '2021-04-14 16:35:33.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review-1

There were some issues with generation of CentOS Stream 8 images for AArch64 few days ago. Infra team sorted them out (with a bit of my help). Queue of jobs got sorted out. At this moment there are 11 (in total) jobs in check-arm64 pipeline.

I do not know does anyone uses CentOS based images on AArch64 architecture. I know they are supposed to work all the time so when they are not I check what is going on and try to find time to fix it.'}, {'account_id': 12404, 'date': '2021-04-14 16:42:45.000000000', 'content': 'Abandoned'}]

commit_message:
Add support for placement_api_uwsgi_config in Debian

This patch is adding the configuration of the number of workers,
threads, and the size of the listen queue in Debian, which uses
uwsgi to run Placement API. Therefore, this patch adds a new
placement_api_uwsgi_config provider as well as a new
placement::wsgi::uwsgi class.

Change-Id: I6e340f551d11e3c003f7873a4ccffba262411e52

commit_message:
Add support for cinder_api_uwsgi_config in Debian

This patch is adding the configuration of the number of workers,
threads, and the size of the listen queue in Debian, which uses
uwsgi to run Cinder API. Therefore, this patch adds a new
cinder_api_uwsgi_config provider as well as a new
cinder::wsgi::uwsgi class.

Change-Id: I6f4c6a51f8e33616069411a926a63ba2b388e25d

commit_message:
Add support for gnocchi_api_uwsgi_config in Debian

This patch is adding the configuration of the number of workers,
threads, and the size of the listen queue in Debian, which uses
uwsgi to run Gnocchi API. Therefore, this patch adds a new
gnocchi_api_uwsgi_config providers as well as a new
gnocchi::wsgi::uwsgi_api class.

Change-Id: Iea9a674be86902be46fdc124e6d0ecf0c1ec8961

commit_message:
Add support for barbican_api_uwsgi_config in Debian

This patch is adding the configuration of the number of workers,
threads, and the size of the listen queue in Debian, which uses
uwsgi to run Nova API. Therefore, this patch adds a new
barbican_api_uwsgi_config provider as well as a new
barbican::wsgi::uwsgi class.

Change-Id: I3acdc3021e787ae1bc5e4ed3c464d530bfbde50a

[{'created': '2021-03-30 13:16:26.000000000', 'message': 'Add support for vlan_limit option

This parameter is currently set to 1 by default, but we should set
it to 2 to enable vlan_transparent, which requires nested vlans.

commit_message:
Add support for vlan_limit option

This change introduces support for the vlan_limit option.
This parameter is currently set to 1 by default, but we should set
it to 2 to enable vlan_transparent, which requires nested vlans.

Related-Bug: #1918418
Change-Id: Id9aaab2a1e3ad2d2d43cd5cddf389d20abaf4461
(cherry picked from commit 4887f4ccd6e1031c3f4cc8fdbc17b77b4eecda0b)
(cherry picked from commit 14011d69c18e628a3466fa71db25cefb7adff425)

This patch is adding the configuration of the number of workers,

designate::wsgi::uwsgi class.

commit_message:
Skip content provider job for irrelevant files

Currently content provider job is not skipped even when tripleo job is
skipped, but this is uselesss.
This change ensures that we rely on the same list of irrelevant files
so that the content provider job is skipped when tripleo job is
skipped.

Change-Id: Iee924f673e3c006606071916c906597cbd891962

commit_message:
Add support for panko_api_uwsgi_config in Debian

This patch is adding the configuration of the number of workers,
threads, and the size of the listen queue in Debian, which uses
uwsgi to run Panko API. Therefore, this patch adds a new
panko_api_uwsgi_config provider as well as a new
panko::wsgi::uwsgi class.

Change-Id: I23414fe7af21c16ef8405066b4f5f4555f2511f6

commit_message:
taas OSC commands

Add possibility to tap-as-a-service to use openstack commands instead
of deprecated neutron commands.

Closes-Bug: #1874701

Change-Id: I339f42a63789a946011700902724a58647c80b9d

commit_message:
Add support for aodh_api_uwsgi_config in Debian

This patch is adding the configuration of the number of workers,
threads, and the size of the listen queue in Debian, which uses
uwsgi to run Aodh API. Therefore, this patch adds a new
aodh_api_uwsgi_config provider as well as a new
aodh::wsgi::uwsgi class.

Change-Id: Ib00be314fe5abc262d4c35f5fbc5612fcd18972d

centos: enable repos where needed

With RDO use we did not disabled some repositories. This patch disable
them and enable where needed.

Change-Id: Ia9d537fe9c1ad54789d2bfb4027254fbb3defe7e

commit_message:
Add support for manila_api_uwsgi_config in Debian

This patch is adding the configuration of the number of workers,
threads, and the size of the listen queue in Debian, which uses
uwsgi to run Manila API. Therefore, this patch adds a new
manila_api_uwsgi_config provider as well as a new
manila::wsgi::uwsgi class.

Change-Id: I2e50cd3ea3a76b2ca294867ca97f895b93b21f1f

commit_message:
mariadb: Update wsrep notify script for Debian Bullseye

Required for moving to Debian Bullseye that
introduced MariaDB 10.5.x.

Since MariaDB 10.4+ the mysql.user is a view,
therefore the script needs to be updated.

Also update command to include connect timeout,
since the default is around 8 hours - and it blocked
MariaDB connections in Debian Bullseye in some cases.

Change-Id: I687f6fc2ff2fc3b06b93568036e2b2f6032081ad

commit_message:
Add support for cloudkitty_api_uwsgi_config in Debian

This patch is adding the configuration of the number of workers,
threads, and the size of the listen queue in Debian, which uses
uwsgi to run Aodh API. Therefore, this patch adds a new
cloudkitty_api_uwsgi_config provider as well as a new
cloudkitty::wsgi::uwsgi class.

Change-Id: I5d0635800d26327fbdbaa33299927f92eb651fc8

[{'created': '2021-04-12 12:23:06.000000000', 'message': 'WIP/DNM move stonith resource creation to step2

Change-Id: Ib3e2d9c93221dfc2e15974142f30e8c84e7afd63
'}, {'created': '2021-04-14 06:46:41.000000000', 'message': "Move stonith resource creation to step2

With the merging of the pcs on host patchset for train we are seeing a
problem with FFUs on Instance HA environments.

Preamble:
Tripleo keeps the stonith-enabled cluster property set to false until the puppet step 5

With the pcs on host patchset the enablement happens still at step 5 but
it gets triggered during tripleo_ha_wrapper deployment task of
cinder-volume which tries to restart the cinder-volume service (during
the leapp of the first controller) and this hangs forever because
pacemaker is in the following transition:
- stonith-fence_compute-fence-nova is configured
- pacemaker wants to call stonith on for controller-0 (which is probably
  dumb, but it is unlikely we'll be able to change that in the right
  timeframe as it seems a potentially involved change in behaviour)
- Any other action, like cinder-volume restart in this case, is stuck
  and the FFU fails.

If we simply move the stonith resource creation (and change nothing else
in the stonith-enabled property being set at step 5) to step 2, we
fix this.

Tested and with the injection of this puppet-tripleo review into the
FFU queens->train upgrade on an IHA system, now the FFU passes.
Also applied this patch to a Train based IHA deployment and verified
that deployment, redeploy, minor update and scaleup all keep on working.

Closes-Bug: #1923723

Change-Id: Ib3e2d9c93221dfc2e15974142f30e8c84e7afd63
"}]
commit_message:
Move stonith resource creation to step2

With the merging of the pcs on host patchset for train we are seeing a
problem with FFUs on Instance HA environments.

Preamble:
Tripleo keeps the stonith-enabled cluster property set to false until the puppet step 5

With the pcs on host patchset the enablement happens still at step 5 but
it gets triggered during tripleo_ha_wrapper deployment task of
cinder-volume which tries to restart the cinder-volume service (during
the leapp of the first controller) and this hangs forever because
pacemaker is in the following transition:
- stonith-fence_compute-fence-nova is configured
- pacemaker wants to call stonith on for controller-0 (which is probably
  dumb, but it is unlikely we'll be able to change that in the right
  timeframe as it seems a potentially involved change in behaviour)
- Any other action, like cinder-volume restart in this case, is stuck
  and the FFU fails.

If we simply move the stonith resource creation (and change nothing else
in the stonith-enabled property being set at step 5) to step 2, we
fix this.

Tested and with the injection of this puppet-tripleo review into the
FFU queens->train upgrade on an IHA system, now the FFU passes.
Also applied this patch to a Train based IHA deployment and verified
that deployment, redeploy, minor update and scaleup all keep on working.

Closes-Bug: #1923723

Change-Id: Ib3e2d9c93221dfc2e15974142f30e8c84e7afd63

commit_message:
Add py39 support

- update setup.cfg to advertise supported platforms
- fix tox.ini file use version agnostic envlist
- add openstack-tox-py39 job
- minor fix on test file which wrongly assumed that pop
  returns a new dictionary
- added type to release dictionary, which is what would
  have prevented previous item from being introduced.

Change-Id: I60b80ebe41a66d39e6f1a51a3d00c0b9292d42fd

commit_message:
Set ovn_chassis_mac_map in ovn::controller

For distributed vlan in ovn we need to add support of
creating mac addresses per compute and seting them in
external_ids:ovn-chassis-mac-mappings.

Depends-On: https://review.opendev.org/782759
Related-Bug: #1881593
Change-Id: I785400969efba0062aabdca9af2726a7603ef840
(cherry picked from commit ef44eebdc56b839bfbdcb7190c1c1e1ce4fe46d6)

subject: ovn-migration: Update Geneve allocations
messages:
[{'account_id': 8655, 'date': '2021-03-26 15:13:58.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 23804, 'date': '2021-03-28 09:21:56.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

I'm confused about this patch. Even if we reuse the segmentation ids, since the segmentation type is different (VXLAN vs Geneve), why do we need this change?"}, {'account_id': 8655, 'date': '2021-04-01 09:31:54.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

> Patch Set 1:
> 
> I'm confused about this patch. Even if we reuse the segmentation ids, since the segmentation type is different (VXLAN vs Geneve), why do we need this change?

Let's say we have ML2/OVS environment with a VXLAN network with segmentation ID 1. We migrate to OVN and the vxlan network will become Geneve but we won't update the allocations. Next time we create a new Geneve network and it looks and picks the first free allocation, which is 1. We will have two different networks with segmentation ID 1. They both will use the same VNI when encapsulating packets."}, {'account_id': 8655, 'date': '2021-04-01 09:41:03.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Workflow-1

I wanted to abandon this patch in favor of https://review.opendev.org/c/openstack/neutron/+/784352
but I will keep it open to finish discussion with Daniel if this change is even needed.'}, {'account_id': 23804, 'date': '2021-04-14 13:54:34.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

Thanks Kuba, I +2ed the other patch'}, {'account_id': 8655, 'date': '2021-04-14 14:43:46.000000000', 'content': 'Abandoned

Incorporated in https://review.opendev.org/c/openstack/neutron/+/784352'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2021-03-26 15:13:58.000000000', 'message': 'ovn-migration: Update Geneve allocations

The Geneve allocations needs to be set to 1 for Geneve networks that use
that segmetation ID. If this is not done, it happens newly created
Geneve networks use same segmentation ID as the networks created before
the migration.

Change-Id: If9a7605d6c5775de4aadb073bf415123c9872a71
Signed-off-by: Jakub Libosvar <libosvar@redhat.com>
'}]
commit_message:
ovn-migration: Update Geneve allocations

The Geneve allocations needs to be set to 1 for Geneve networks that use
that segmetation ID. If this is not done, it happens newly created
Geneve networks use same segmentation ID as the networks created before
the migration.

Change-Id: If9a7605d6c5775de4aadb073bf415123c9872a71
Signed-off-by: Jakub Libosvar <libosvar@redhat.com>

commit_message:
fix tox python3 overrides

We want to default to running all tox environments under python 3, so
set the basepython value in each environment.

We do not want to specify a minor version number, because we do not
want to have to update the file every time we upgrade python.

We do not want to set the override once in testenv, because that
breaks the more specific versions used in default environments like
py35 and py36.

Change-Id: I28728cdb29bb3530ad5fe84353e10988ec697515

revisions:
[{'created': '2019-09-17 18:13:03.000000000', 'message': "[train][goal] Define new 'networking-bagpipe-tempest-ipv6-only' job

As part of Train community goal 'Support IPv6-Only Deployments and Testing'[1],
Tempest has defined the base job 'devstack-tempest-ipv6' which will
deploy services on IPv6.

This commit adds the new job 'networking-bagpipe-tempest-ipv6-only'
run on gate which is derived from 'tempest-ipv6-only'.

Verification structure will be:
- 'devstack-IPv6' deploy the service on IPv6
- 'devstack-tempest-ipv6' run will verify the IPv6-only setting and listen address
- 'networking-bagpipe-tempest-ipv6-only' will run the tests.

Story: #2005477
Task: #35908

[1] https://governance.openstack.org/tc/goals/train/ipv6-support-and-testing.html

Change-Id: I171f0107c108e384345e585f54113818e4d4cce1

commit_message:
[train][goal] Define new 'networking-bagpipe-tempest-ipv6-only' job

As part of Train community goal 'Support IPv6-Only Deployments and Testing'[1],
Tempest has defined the base job 'devstack-tempest-ipv6' which will
deploy services on IPv6.

This commit adds the new job 'networking-bagpipe-tempest-ipv6-only'
run on gate which is derived from 'tempest-ipv6-only'.

Verification structure will be:
- 'devstack-IPv6' deploy the service on IPv6
- 'devstack-tempest-ipv6' run will verify the IPv6-only setting and listen address
- 'networking-bagpipe-tempest-ipv6-only' will run the tests.

Story: #2005477
Task: #35908

[1] https://governance.openstack.org/tc/goals/train/ipv6-support-and-testing.html

Change-Id: I171f0107c108e384345e585f54113818e4d4cce1

commit_message:
Remove the unused coding style modules

Python modules related to coding style checks (listed in blacklist.txt in
openstack/requirements repo) are dropped from lower-constraints.txt
as they are not actually used in tests (other than pep8).

more info: https://github.com/openstack/requirements/blob/master/blacklist.txt

Change-Id: I151f755817714d3564f4ff603011c84332cb4539

revisions:
[{'created': '2020-07-09 05:02:57.000000000', 'message': 'Switch from unittest2 compat methods to Python 3.x methods

With the removal of Python 2.x we can remove the unittest2 compat
wrappers and switch to assertCountEqual instead of assertItemsEqual

We have been able to use them since then, because
testtools required unittest2, which still included it. With testtools
removing Python 2.7 support [3][4], we will lose support for
assertItemsEqual, so we should switch to use assertCountEqual.

[1] - https://bugs.python.org/issue17866
[2] - https://hg.python.org/cpython/rev/d9921cb6e3cd
[3] - testing-cabal/testtools#286
[4] - testing-cabal/testtools#277

Change-Id: Ib3518cae0a5dcbf66f6f3ee8df6a2488722d53f1
'}]
commit_message:
Switch from unittest2 compat methods to Python 3.x methods

With the removal of Python 2.x we can remove the unittest2 compat
wrappers and switch to assertCountEqual instead of assertItemsEqual

We have been able to use them since then, because
testtools required unittest2, which still included it. With testtools
removing Python 2.7 support [3][4], we will lose support for
assertItemsEqual, so we should switch to use assertCountEqual.

[1] - https://bugs.python.org/issue17866
[2] - https://hg.python.org/cpython/rev/d9921cb6e3cd
[3] - testing-cabal/testtools#286
[4] - testing-cabal/testtools#277

Change-Id: Ib3518cae0a5dcbf66f6f3ee8df6a2488722d53f1

commit_message:
Fix missing "is_sort_key" for basic vpnaas attributes

Patch [1] introduced need to explicity set with "is_sort_key"
flag to attributes which attribute can be used as sort key.
This patch adds it to base attributes in vpnaas resources, like:
* id,
* tenant_id,
* name,
* subnet_id,
* router_id

This commit also updates sphinx requirements to make requirements
jobs passing.

[1] https://review.opendev.org/#/c/653903/

Conflicts:
  test-requirements.txt

NOTE(elod.illes): sphinx constraints are already fixed in stable/stein.

Change-Id: Ibe1aee0346e3fc21215d1b3be8752224aa2c162d
Closes-Bug: #1832225
(cherry picked from commit 183934eae66d8a411b8f2d7f7cb00ebbc4152d7c)

commit_message:
Fix bgp tests with pre-existing announcements

When there are tenant networks already being announced, some bgp tests
currently fail. Set advertise_tenant_networks to False in those tests'
bgp speakers as a workaround.

Change-Id: Idcb6f960ed88df95594e1408c48937c8860cc8df
Needed-By: https://review.opendev.org/569091

commit_message:
Switch from unittest2 compat methods to Python 3.x methods

With the removal of Python 2.x we can remove the unittest2 compat
wrappers and switch to assertCountEqual instead of assertItemsEqual

We have been able to use them since then, because
testtools required unittest2, which still included it. With testtools
removing Python 2.7 support [3][4], we will lose support for
assertItemsEqual, so we should switch to use assertCountEqual.

[1] - https://bugs.python.org/issue17866

read 'local_endpoint' from neutron database.

commit_message:
Remove ocata jobs from branch

This repo configures two ocata jobs to run as periodic jobs, these
need to be only in the stable/ocata and not in this branch - remove
them.

The stable/ocata branch has these jobs configured, so the jobs continue
to run - but the Zuul setup is simplified.

Change-Id: I57958f8388505aee5654f20c0c9c60f0e3ceea15
(cherry picked from commit 431ad460f85136fcad773818f3b12f3a17917b95)

commit_message:
Remove ocata jobs from branch

This repo configures two ocata jobs to run as periodic jobs, these
need to be only in the stable/ocata and not in this branch - remove
them.

The stable/ocata branch has these jobs configured, so the jobs continue
to run - but the Zuul setup is simplified.

Change-Id: I57958f8388505aee5654f20c0c9c60f0e3ceea15
(cherry picked from commit 431ad460f85136fcad773818f3b12f3a17917b95)

commit_message:
QOS DSCP marking traffic test

Add a DSCP marking traffic test by applying
DSCP marking on host A and pinging host B from it.
Using tcpdump the DSCP mark of arriving pings on
host B is verified.

Change-Id: I0d46ff77c392b0468578954257e6a2232a9b408e

> Hmmmm....
 > During test runs in the bagpipe-bgp logs I see tracebacks like
 > this:
 > 
...
 > 
 > see: https://8e8576cef9278262b7b7-2de800c51e9ddb963f260573366c025b.ssl.cf5.rackcdn.com/702895/2/check/legacy-networking-bagpipe-dsvm-fullstack/ad3c06a/logs/dsvm-fullstack-logs/TestConnectivitySameBGPVPN.test_l3_network_connectivity_Linuxbridge_/


This seems like a bug in the cleanup test ; perhaps does it happen when a delete is done on an endpoint for which attach failed or is still in progress.

I would not expect this to block the test though (but perhaps I'm wrong).


One thing about fullstack tests: they are "nice to have" because they test a log of things with few resources, but they were quite a huge task to write, and to maintain. See https://review.opendev.org/#/c/500109/ which I abandoned for lack of time to find a fix: perhaps the technical context has changed and this is doable now.   My point is: don't spend too much energy on this one.   An alternative to consider would be to write multinode devstack jobs (if possible covering the OVS and linuxbridge drivers, but this is not a prerequisite).'}, {'account_id': 8313, 'date': '2020-02-14 16:11:58.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

revisions:
[{'created': '2020-01-16 15:33:40.000000000', 'message': 'Fix fullstack tests

This patch aimes to make fullstack tests working again, so it contains
multiple small fixes due to changes in neutron itself, and due to
python2 - python3 differences for example.

Short list of change reasons here:
1) range() and filter() gives back an iterator from py3
2) https://review.opendev.org/579100 removed central_external_bridge
from neutron fullstack enviroment.
3) configparser now expects config options to be strings.

Closes-Bug: #1859861
Change-Id: I627217c439dd0c90361580956c9ca13480fc10fe
'}, {'created': '2020-01-17 15:38:54.000000000', 'message': 'Fix fullstack tests

This patch aimes to make fullstack tests working again, so it contains

commit_message:
Fix fullstack tests

This patch aimes to make fullstack tests working again, so it contains
multiple small fixes due to changes in neutron itself, and due to
python2 - python3 differences for example.

Short list of change reasons here:
1) range() and filter() gives back an iterator from py3
2) https://review.opendev.org/579100 removed central_external_bridge
from neutron fullstack enviroment.
3) configparser now expects config options to be strings.
4) Change the way rootwrap is deployed, to make it effective for bagpipe
tests.
5) Make apipaste config work for bagpipe fullstack tests.
6) setup mpls routing on zuul machines.

TODO
2) find out why ping is not working for bgpvpn connectivity tests

Closes-Bug: #1859861
Depends-On: https://review.opendev.org/712702
Change-Id: I627217c439dd0c90361580956c9ca13480fc10fe

Thank you for your first contribution to OpenStack.

Your patch will now be tested automatically by OpenStack testing frameworks
and once the automatic tests pass, it will be reviewed by other friendly
developers. They will give you feedback and may require you to refine it.

People seldom get their patch approved on the first try, so don't be
concerned if requested to make corrections. Feel free to modify your patch
and resubmit a new change-set.

Patches usually take 3 to 7 days to be reviewed so be patient and be
available on IRC to ask and answer questions about your work. Also it
takes generally at least a couple of weeks for cores to get around to
reviewing code. The more you participate in the community the more
rewarding it is for you. You may also notice that the more you get to know
people and get to be known, the faster your patches will be reviewed and
eventually approved. Get to know others and become known by doing code
reviews: anybody can do it, and it's a great way to learn the code base.

Thanks again for supporting OpenStack, we look forward to working with you.

commit_message:
Update UPPER_CONSTRAINTS_FILE for stable/stein

Update the URL to the upper-constraints file to point to the redirect
rule on releases.openstack.org so that anyone working on this branch
will switch to the correct upper-constraints list automatically when
the requirements repository branches.

Until the requirements repository has as stable/stein branch, tests will
continue to use the upper-constraints list on master.

Change-Id: I2f94c180557e377e712f333040a6fc0ae8fa78f2

docs failure is due to the fact that neutron-lib is capped in the global upper-constraints, but neutron itself isn't. commit_message:
Fix stable gate issues due to environment changes

A couple things have changed in the environment that now cause jobs to
fail. This squashes a couple commits to add a bindep file to make sure
system packages are installed, and switches over the functional job to
get rid of an outdated setup script that no longer works.

Included changes are:
Add libpq-dev to bindep.txt to fix gate error
(cherry picked from commit 315eefc9b55df58060e4760fe90f7f545ef0753d)

Switch functional job to Zuulv3 syntax
(cherry picked from commit 2c500c9061ff980c565ed3473a128215a2da916c)

Combine two patches to fix gates
1 - Bump psycopg2 version from 2.6.2 to 2.7.7.
2 - All constants should be consumed from neutron_lib
(cherry picked from commit a42d5fad7952a98b59227d4ac26b02bf0d29080e)

Update sphinx requirements
(cherry picked from commit 7ff51c0c4d24099964e4f0a9dc4831088be4caa8)

Depends-on: https://review.opendev.org/697371

Change-Id: Ibe8254166cea4000d859f67c1e93eb6c5a743ec1

commit_message:
Support QoS by meter action

Currently, QoS is implemented by TC command of HV OS.
This solution has many drawbacks, such as not supported
VLAN network or VMs from same HV.

Meter is a comfortable solution, because it is implemented
in OpenFlow, so it is flexible and exact.

Conflicts:
	networking_ovn/common/ovn_client.py

Change-Id: I2373a81ca2c5d6616c0097f15dd59327116db93f
Closes-Bug: #1850609
(cherry picked from commit e7df3706043df6d117758547cf6e41f8d097af14)
(cherry picked from commit f21d4d5b34438f3e164e5963e5799256c8bfae4f)

subject: Switch to use neutron-tempest-plugin for neutron-dynamic-routing tests
messages:
[{'account_id': 6854, 'date': '2019-10-02 13:35:38.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 6854, 'date': '2019-10-03 01:10:06.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 2: Patch Set 1 was rebased.'}, {'account_id': 6854, 'date': '2019-10-10 04:34:42.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

legacy job failure looks unrelated. for some reasons it seems running on bionic.'}, {'account_id': 11975, 'date': '2019-10-11 10:56:20.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2: Code-Review-1

in stable branches those tests are still in neutron-dynamic-routing repo. We don't run this job defined in neutron-tempest-plugin for stable branches of neutron-dynamic-routing. So do we really need such change in stable branches for networking-midonet?"}, {'account_id': 6854, 'date': '2019-10-11 13:58:14.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2:

Slawek,

tempest and its plugin should be branchless.
it's one of the reasons we introduced neutron-tempest-plugin in the first place.

i don't see any reason to prefer the copy in neutron-dynamic-routing.
having tempest-plugin in the same repo has been a problem for us. eg. it has been one of blockers of lower-constraints job on this repo.

IMO, neutron-dynamic-routing should switch to use neutron-tempest-plugin as well. I don't insist though."}, {'account_id': 11975, 'date': '2019-10-14 08:10:30.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2:

> Slawek,
 > 
 > tempest and its plugin should be branchless.
 > it's one of the reasons we introduced neutron-tempest-plugin in the
 > first place.
 > 
 > i don't see any reason to prefer the copy in neutron-dynamic-routing.
 > having tempest-plugin in the same repo has been a problem for us.
 > eg. it has been one of blockers of lower-constraints job on this
 > repo.
 > 
 > IMO, neutron-dynamic-routing should switch to use neutron-tempest-plugin
 > as well. I don't insist though.

I know that neutron-tempest-plugin is branchless. But from the other hand with this migration of tests from e.g. neutron-dynamic-routing to the neutron-tempest-plugin repo we can be only sure that those tests works for ussuri (current master) and newer as we are not running those tests against e.g. stable/train or stein. For those branches neutron-dynamic-routing tempest plugin is still branched and placed in neutron-dynamic-routing repo.
And we can't remove those tests from stable branches easily as this could e.g. cause problems with packaging of those stable branches for distros like rdo.

Because of that I think that it would be better to run those tests only on branches on which we are running them also in neutron-tempest-plugin queues (so ussuri and newer).

Is my understanding wrong here?"}, {'account_id': 6854, 'date': '2019-10-15 04:57:28.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2:

Slawek,

i guess you are missing two points:

- this patch actually skips all tests migrated from neutron-dynamic-routing.

- for networking-midonet, actually there's no choice because the test we care (namely neutron_tempest_plugin.neutron_dynamic_routing.scenario.test_simple_bgp.Bgp) is not available in neutron-dynamic-routing repo. it has been migrated from networking-midonet repo, not neutron-dynamic-routing.

wrt supporting older branches, i'm fine as far as there's a reasonable way to skip them. (as this patch does)"}, {'account_id': 11975, 'date': '2019-10-16 08:04:33.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2: Code-Review+2

> Slawek,
 > 
 > i guess you are missing two points:
 > 
 > - this patch actually skips all tests migrated from
 > neutron-dynamic-routing.
 > 
 > - for networking-midonet, actually there's no choice because the
 > test we care (namely neutron_tempest_plugin.neutron_dynamic_routing.scenario.test_simple_bgp.Bgp)
 > is not available in neutron-dynamic-routing repo. it has been
 > migrated from networking-midonet repo, not neutron-dynamic-routing.
 > 
 > wrt supporting older branches, i'm fine as far as there's a
 > reasonable way to skip them. (as this patch does)

Ok, I see now. Thx."}, {'account_id': 21798, 'date': '2019-10-17 11:12:16.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Code-Review+2 Workflow+1

OK so this is to get an almost "networking-midonet test" in, lgtm'}, {'account_id': 21798, 'date': '2019-10-18 13:35:37.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2: -Workflow

Let's get train https://review.opendev.org/#/c/686163 in first"}, {'account_id': 21798, 'date': '2020-11-16 10:32:55.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Workflow+1'}, {'account_id': 21798, 'date': '2020-11-17 20:23:32.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

recheck test pep8 result'}, {'account_id': 3031, 'date': '2020-11-17 23:57:23.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

Will need 18663cd4d37bda46589ad105aca8b05f058a8cfd backported I think'}, {'account_id': 11975, 'date': '2021-04-14 13:51:43.000000000', 'content': "Abandoned

This review is > 4 weeks without comment, and failed Zuul jobs the last time it was checked. We are abandoning this for now. Feel free to reactivate the review by pressing the restore button and leaving a 'recheck' comment to get fresh test results."}]

revisions:
[{'created': '2019-10-16 17:37:04.000000000', 'message': 'Fix AttributeError with third-party L3 service plugins

A recent patch fix for the Rocky branch from
commit 20fd02611674da5365e93d06f330d1f76fd71e3e have introduced an
AttributeError on Third Party Plugins that does not implement
certain extensions.

This is just related to FWaaSv1 and only applicable to Rocky and below
releases.

This change fixes an issue where in the course of sending firewall
update notifications to the appropriate agents an AttributeError
is encountered due to unsafe assumption of the availability of L3
extensions on the l3_plugin.

This change puts protections in place to avoid this issue.

Change-Id: If5fde4fc9475f468860b0c1fb29db66f1c44f74e
Closes-Bug: #1847019
(cherry picked from commit fc59b08ff78456c98fee0cc187f8888bc99c333e)
'}, {'created': '2019-10-17 21:13:29.000000000', 'message': 'Fix AttributeError with third-party L3 service plugins

This change fixes an issue where in the course of sending firewall

is encountered due to unsafe assumption of the availability of L3

Change-Id: If5fde4fc9475f468860b0c1fb29db66f1c44f74e
Closes-Bug: #1847019
(cherry picked from commit fc59b08ff78456c98fee0cc187f8888bc99c333e)
'}]
commit_message:
Fix AttributeError with third-party L3 service plugins

A recent patch fix for the Rocky branch from
commit 20fd02611674da5365e93d06f330d1f76fd71e3e have introduced an
AttributeError on Third Party Plugins that does not implement
certain extensions.

This is just related to FWaaSv1 and only applicable to Rocky and below
releases.

This change fixes an issue where in the course of sending firewall
update notifications to the appropriate agents an AttributeError
is encountered due to unsafe assumption of the availability of L3
extensions on the l3_plugin.

This change puts protections in place to avoid this issue.

Change-Id: If5fde4fc9475f468860b0c1fb29db66f1c44f74e
Closes-Bug: #1847019
(cherry picked from commit fc59b08ff78456c98fee0cc187f8888bc99c333e)

commit_message:
Use TOX_CONSTRAINTS_FILE

UPPER_CONSTRAINTS_FILE is old name and deprecated
This allows to use upper-constraints file as more
readable way instead of UPPER_CONSTRAINTS_FILE=<lower-constraints file>.

Change-Id: Ifdb5a44389d40bcb0c09f8b3e4fb79da53a49947

commit_message:
Project ID is checked when listing security groups

When a project ID is filtering the security groups listing query,
the API ensures that this project exists.

Depends-On: https://review.opendev.org/#/c/753053
Change-Id: I8a921dae1be3cd9933a261315541d5db97b8c935
Related-Bug: #1896588

When a firewall is created after the routers have been deployed,
we are supposed to manually do a firewall-update on specific routers
where we wanted the firewall policy to be applied in the case of
FWaaS-v1.
But in the case of DVR routers, we have seen the firewall-update
for routers that are deployed in the compute hosts are not getting
propagated properly.
The reason is the firewall update, firewall delete and firewall
create events are not notified to all the respective router hosts.
The original code only handles getting the host information from
the routers that are scheduled to the l3 agent, but in the case of
DVR routers, the routers are only scheduled to the network node l3
agents and the other distributed routers on compute are created
based on the service port binding.

This bug is applicable only for FWaaS-v1 and the patch should be
applied for Rocky release and below, since FWaaS-v1 is not supported
in Stein and Train release.

This patch fixes the problem described above by taking care of
collecting all the hosts involved with DVR routers and notifying
them.

Change-Id: I7ef193baba9447d0f09cd9544cce9d05a956b920
Closes-Bug: #1845557
(cherry picked from commit 20fd02611674da5365e93d06f330d1f76fd71e3e)
'}]
commit_message:
FWaaS-DVR: FWaaS rules not updated in DVR routers on compute host

When a firewall is created after the routers have been deployed,
we are supposed to manually do a firewall-update on specific routers
where we wanted the firewall policy to be applied in the case of
FWaaS-v1.
But in the case of DVR routers, we have seen the firewall-update
for routers that are deployed in the compute hosts are not getting
propagated properly.
The reason is the firewall update, firewall delete and firewall
create events are not notified to all the respective router hosts.
The original code only handles getting the host information from
the routers that are scheduled to the l3 agent, but in the case of
DVR routers, the routers are only scheduled to the network node l3
agents and the other distributed routers on compute are created
based on the service port binding.

This bug is applicable only for FWaaS-v1 and the patch should be
applied for Rocky release and below, since FWaaS-v1 is not supported
in Stein and Train release.

This patch fixes the problem described above by taking care of
collecting all the hosts involved with DVR routers and notifying
them.

Change-Id: I7ef193baba9447d0f09cd9544cce9d05a956b920
Closes-Bug: #1845557
(cherry picked from commit 20fd02611674da5365e93d06f330d1f76fd71e3e)

revisions:
[{'created': '2020-07-24 19:26:48.000000000', 'message': 'Allow a precheck for adding Events

WaitEvents are useful for when you want to wait for something that
you know has not happened yet. e.g. register an event to wait for
a MAC_Binding event, create a port, and call event.wait().

If you need to wait for an event that you aren't sure has not
happened, e.g. a logical switch is created on one API server and
the request for creating a port on it is created on another that
may or may not have received the DB update yet, then you need a
safe way to register a WaitEvent that will not block until timeout
if the event has already passed.

This patch adds a "precheck" method where you return True to
continue, or False to abort registering the event. This is run with
the event handler lock held, so no events should be processed while
running this check.

Change-Id: I22e52f10f35e19c0c97e93eec0c2b2999c775791
'}]
commit_message:
Allow a precheck for adding Events

WaitEvents are useful for when you want to wait for something that
you know has not happened yet. e.g. register an event to wait for
a MAC_Binding event, create a port, and call event.wait().

If you need to wait for an event that you aren't sure has not
happened, e.g. a logical switch is created on one API server and
the request for creating a port on it is created on another that
may or may not have received the DB update yet, then you need a
safe way to register a WaitEvent that will not block until timeout
if the event has already passed.

This patch adds a "precheck" method where you return True to
continue, or False to abort registering the event. This is run with
the event handler lock held, so no events should be processed while
running this check.

Change-Id: I22e52f10f35e19c0c97e93eec0c2b2999c775791

commit_message:
Run devstack jobs on bionic

Currently the zookeeper that is packaged with Ubuntu Focal does
not run on jdk8 (even though no dependencies allow it)

Until a proper fix is found continue to use bionic.

(Also fix some dependency issues and sync flake settings with neutron project)

Change-Id: I77c9222ce9c49a83e3284136db490b53c54b92de

Concerning the hashes, in the case we decide to continue we V, U, T, can't we use more appropriate hash? I mean I suppose it will be possible to retrieve commits more related to these periods (V, U, T), isn't?

As said in my previous comment, usually we avoid to add deliverables on old series, however, this kind of plugin is tagless and our goal here is just to create stable branches, so, maybe we can do an exception here, let's discuss this topic during our next meeting.

Concerning the Wallaby part, the final release is today, so even if this patch isn't merged today we will not block this part after the release point, again this is only to branch things and not to deliver a new version, so, I don't think it's problem for the release team."}, {'account_id': 30491, 'date': '2021-04-14 07:22:51.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2:

commit_message:
W,V,U,T branch for devstack-plugin-ceph

The plugin has just become branched [1] which means its
current master is compatible with all currently supported
releases.

This patch creates a branch for every supported release,
which was also discussed and agreed on IRC [2].

[1] https://review.opendev.org/c/openstack/governance/+/786067
[2] http://eavesdrop.openstack.org/irclogs/%23openstack-qa/%23openstack-qa.2021-04-13.log.html#t2021-04-13T17:39:40

Change-Id: Icf74f6b759f497c7672c1b642540d14e3340936b

revisions:
[{'created': '2020-09-21 07:36:59.000000000', 'message': 'Resolve issues with MySQL 8.x and alembic

Using python 3.8 to run dbmigration recently yields the following
error:

  "sqlalchemy.exc.OperationalError: (pymysql.err.OperationalError) (3959, "Check constraint 'firewall_rules_v2_chk_1' uses column 'public', hence column cannot be dropped or renamed.")"

The root cause is a bug in alembic [1] and it appears this will be
difficult if not impossible to resolve there. Disabling constraints is
the recommended solution so do just that.

Please also see similar patch: I678d067be9a412212ec57ec3900aeecf3c6b6198
[1] https://github.com/sqlalchemy/alembic/issues/699

Change-Id: I3b27037e68468d8dad54143818c4ba243a440e1d
'}]
commit_message:
Resolve issues with MySQL 8.x and alembic

Using python 3.8 to run dbmigration recently yields the following
error:

  "sqlalchemy.exc.OperationalError: (pymysql.err.OperationalError) (3959, "Check constraint 'firewall_rules_v2_chk_1' uses column 'public', hence column cannot be dropped or renamed.")"

The root cause is a bug in alembic [1] and it appears this will be
difficult if not impossible to resolve there. Disabling constraints is
the recommended solution so do just that.

Please also see similar patch: I678d067be9a412212ec57ec3900aeecf3c6b6198
[1] https://github.com/sqlalchemy/alembic/issues/699

Change-Id: I3b27037e68468d8dad54143818c4ba243a440e1d

Hi, while I greatly appreciate the initiative here, before going ahead with this and the client-side patch, first step is to document how you believe the project meets the criteria as identified for other sub-projects [1] . My suggestion would be to post a patch to the specs repo as first step and elaborate how criteria are met or are going to be met. Then we can look at patches (like this one) in the context of the assessment to make sure we're not forgetting anything.

[1] http://specs.openstack.org/openstack/neutron-specs/specs/stadium/ocata.html"}, {'account_id': 17776, 'date': '2017-06-27 07:00:53.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 2.'}, {'account_id': 17776, 'date': '2017-06-27 07:12:11.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 3.'}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2017-06-27 09:27:02.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3: Verified-1

What's the current status? we don't see any assessment patch on tas-as-a-service. This is what Armando suggested and a reasonable first step to move forward the inclusion of tap-as-a-service."}, {'account_id': 841, 'date': '2017-06-27 12:24:32.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3: Workflow-1

WIP until the situation changes.'}, {'account_id': 17776, 'date': '2017-06-27 13:10:51.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3: Workflow-1

Akihiro : https://review.openstack.org/454788 for reference'}, {'account_id': 6854, 'date': '2017-08-03 03:15:46.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3: Code-Review-1

(1 comment)'}, {'account_id': 841, 'date': '2017-08-03 06:06:08.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3:

I think you can implement TaaS OSC support in your repository first as it uses entry_points. I think it is better as you test the client support well. Otherwise, you cannot release CLI support until it is approved as the neutron stadium. Thought?'}, {'account_id': 17776, 'date': '2017-08-12 04:19:10.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3:

@Akihiro : We can move it both ways. We can proceed for testing TaaS OSC support in TaaS repo first, and then merge it in NeutronClient, or start with the neutronclient work directly.
I do not think it would be a major issue, but I would like to know how long should the TaaS repo maintain TaaS OSC CLIs before it can be migrated to neutronclient'}, {'account_id': 17776, 'date': '2017-08-12 04:23:25.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 4.'}, {'account_id': 17776, 'date': '2017-08-12 04:28:37.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 5.'}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2017-08-12 06:09:17.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 5: Verified+1

What is the current status of TaaS? In the current policy so far, only OSC support for projects under the neutron governance are accepted to the neutronclient repo. On the other hand, no CLI support blocks several efforts to make TaaS mature. My current suggestion is to implement OSC plugin in TaaS repository. Considering this, I put -W.'}, {'account_id': 17776, 'date': '2018-09-14 05:00:13.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 5:

https://review.openstack.org/#/c/398767/ might be a better option in that case then'}, {'account_id': 17776, 'date': '2018-09-14 05:00:22.000000000', 'content': 'Abandoned

Abondoning for now'}, {'account_id': 17776, 'date': '2018-09-28 14:03:25.000000000', 'content': 'Restored

Restoring for Deepak Tiwari to continue the efforts'}, {'account_id': 17776, 'date': '2018-09-28 14:12:47.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 6: Commit message was updated.'}, {'account_id': 13995, 'date': '2018-09-28 18:15:44.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 6:

There is a discussion in the mailing list on deprecating all of the python-*client packages and a new way for development of openstackclient [1].  I realize that discussion may not happen in a timely fashion vis-a-vis TaaS stadium membership for Stein, but I do worry that this development is occurring on a dead end.

Not downvoting this; if y'all want to accept the risk and move forward then go with my blessings.  But I wanted you to be forewarned.

[1] http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-dev/2018-September/135107.html is the root of the email chain"}, {'account_id': 17776, 'date': '2018-10-01 06:44:54.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 6:

@Nate: Both OSC and NeutronClient patches are running in parallel. The objective is to ensure clarity on the Neutron Stadium side, and also create the plugins for OSC. In case NeutronClient patch is not required in the future, it can be abandoned, if OpenstackClient patch is worthy enough for the inclusion of TaaS in the Neutron Stadium...maybe Miguel Lavelle can shine a light on that?'}, {'account_id': 841, 'date': '2018-10-01 15:40:51.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 6: Code-Review-1

(1 comment)'}, {'account_id': 841, 'date': '2018-10-01 15:41:31.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 6:

In the current approach, the python binding is implemented in the CLI layer (neutronclient/osc/v2/taas/common.py). This cannot be accepted. This is a layer violation.'}, {'account_id': 27589, 'date': '2018-10-08 19:32:17.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 10:

@Akihiro,

Pls check if the approach in following change (this was a duplicate effort which shall be abandoned) is acceptable?

https://review.openstack.org/#/c/589253/6/neutronclient/v2_0/client.py'}, {'account_id': 27589, 'date': '2018-10-09 13:59:00.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 11.'}, {'account_id': 27589, 'date': '2018-10-10 21:05:28.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 12: Patch Set 11 was rebased'}, {'account_id': 27589, 'date': '2018-11-17 18:25:13.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 13.'}, {'account_id': 27589, 'date': '2018-11-17 20:34:48.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 14.'}, {'account_id': 27589, 'date': '2018-11-17 20:48:03.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 14:

@Akihiro, I have moved the python binding layer implementation to neutronclient/v2/clients.py file as per your suggestion. In fact, I have used the existing create_ext, update_ext, list_ext, update_ext, show_ext functions. Please check and if you find it ok, then please provide +1/+2 for this commit'}, {'account_id': 27589, 'date': '2018-11-17 20:52:01.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 15: Patch Set 14 was rebased'}, {'account_id': 27589, 'date': '2018-11-18 00:05:34.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 16.'}, {'account_id': 27589, 'date': '2018-11-18 05:53:35.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 17.'}, {'account_id': 27589, 'date': '2018-11-18 13:07:44.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 17:

I cannot vote +2 on this change because tap-as-a-service is not a part of the neutron stadium yet and python-neutronclient repository support only services under the neutron stadium. As you may know, there is no L2GW support in the python-neutronclient repository.'}, {'account_id': 841, 'date': '2019-12-23 13:42:12.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 25:

If there is no plan that tap-as-a-service is included in the neutron stadium near future, I would suggest to add CLI support in the tap-as-a-service repository rather than python-neutronclient repo. Once tap-as-a-service becomes part of the neutron stadium, it can easily be moved to the python-neutronclient repo as the current OSC support.'}, {'account_id': 8313, 'date': '2020-01-06 13:51:52.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 25: -Code-Review

Thanks Akihiro, so taas some similar solution is expected like for l2gw, see:
https://opendev.org/openstack/networking-l2gw/src/branch/master/networking_l2gw/l2gatewayclient'}, {'account_id': 11975, 'date': '2020-01-07 13:00:00.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 25: Code-Review-1

> If there is no plan that tap-as-a-service is included in the
 > neutron stadium near future, I would suggest to add CLI support in
 > the tap-as-a-service repository rather than python-neutronclient
 > repo. Once tap-as-a-service becomes part of the neutron stadium, it
 > can easily be moved to the python-neutronclient repo as the current
 > OSC support.

I agree with Akihiro here. I don't think that there are any plans to include taas as stadium project soon. Maybe we can revive this discussion in V cycle or even later but for now there are no such plans AFAICT."}, {'account_id': 11975, 'date': '2020-01-07 13:00:08.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 25: Code-Review-2'}, {'account_id': 11975, 'date': '2021-04-14 13:48:08.000000000', 'content': 'Abandoned

This review is > 4 weeks without comment and currently blocked by a core reviewer with a -2. We are abandoning this for now. Feel free to reactivate the review by pressing the restore button and contacting the reviewer with the -2 on this review to ensure you address their concerns.'}]

commit_message:
Add support for TaaS in NeutronClient

This patch adds the support for TaaS as an OSC
Plugin in Neutronclient.

Co-Authored-By: Deepak Tiwari <deepak.tiwari@aricent.com>
Change-Id: Ie15c596748a315d34b3edfa872c30fd20a9308b0

bug #1006226

the exception Invalid detach is called from the module quantum.exceptions but is not defined under the same.
In this fix, a new exception is added to the cisco.exceptions module and the exception called by inplug_interface is
redirected to the cisco.exceptions.

Change-Id: Ib433af753f9275c8cec3d39b1c5210df250ccfb6

commit_message:
unplug_interface of cisco plugin's l2network_plugin.py references non-existing exception InvalidDetach.

bug #1006226

the exception Invalid detach is called from the module quantum.exceptions but is not defined under the same.
In this fix, a new exception is added to the cisco.exceptions module and the exception called by inplug_interface is
redirected to the cisco.exceptions.

Change-Id: Ib433af753f9275c8cec3d39b1c5210df250ccfb6

[{'created': '2019-06-14 20:18:14.000000000', 'message': '[WIP]: Add SR-IOV ML2 driver support for VLAN trunking.

Add VLAN trunking support for SR-IOV VFs based on Intel i40e NIC
driver.

The current SRIOV driver for trunking is based on Intel i40e NIC
driver with following requirements:-

hardware: Intel Ethernet Network Adapter XXV710 (25GbE)
Driver: Intel i40e v4.16.0

Change-Id: I9f679e109290c3f6955dd63227d802355ee71d2d

hardware: Intel Ethernet Network Adapter XXV710 (25GbE)
Driver: Intel i40e v2.7.12 onwards

Closes-Bug: 1794771

Change-Id: I9f679e109290c3f6955dd63227d802355ee71d2d
Co-Authored-By: Manjeet Singh Bhatia <manjeet.s.bhatia@intel.com>

commit_message:
Add SR-IOV ML2 driver support for VLAN trunking.

Add VLAN trunking support for SR-IOV VFs based on Intel i40e NIC
driver.

The current SRIOV driver for trunking is based on Intel i40e NIC
driver with following requirements:-

hardware: Intel Ethernet Network Adapter XXV710 (25GbE)
Driver: Intel i40e v2.7.12 onwards

Closes-Bug: 1794771

Change-Id: I9f679e109290c3f6955dd63227d802355ee71d2d
Co-Authored-By: Manjeet Singh Bhatia <manjeet.s.bhatia@intel.com>

Use importlib to take place of imp module

The imp module is deprecated[1] since version 3.4, use importlib to
instead

[1]: https://docs.python.org/3/library/imp.html

revisions:
[{'created': '2020-01-28 20:50:32.000000000', 'message': "objects: automatically detect whether engine facade is used

While we added new_facade object attribute to framework and it has its
niche and used in some stadium subprojects, it's not ideal because it's
global to an object. Meaning that if you mark an object for new_facade =
True, *all* business logic using the object must also switch to new
facade in the same step, which is a pain and sometimes close to
impossible to do without changing thousands loosely related lines of
code in multiple modules. It would be nice to instead use objects as
usual in different contexts - some using engine facade and some still
using session.begin(...) - and allow the OVO framework to pick the right
way to nest subtransactions.

This patch does exactly that. We call an internal function from oslo.db
and check whether it raises an exception. If it does, it means that the
engine facade is not used; otherwise, we use the new style of nested
transactions management.

By default, if session is not active when OVO action is called, we stick
to the old facade. Once we are done with switching the rest of the
plugin code / OVO objects to the new facade, we will rip off the
transitionary logic.

Change-Id: Ia05df925eccf3c9d397748f282e995203a058de9
Partially-Implements: blueprint enginefacade-switch
Partially-Implements: blueprint adopt-oslo-versioned-objects-for-db
(cherry picked from commit 92b95815318806f90eca987145ad453782dd7041)

Change-Id: Ia05df925eccf3c9d397748f282e995203a058de9

commit_message:
objects: automatically detect whether engine facade is used

While we added new_facade object attribute to framework and it has its
niche and used in some stadium subprojects, it's not ideal because it's
global to an object. Meaning that if you mark an object for new_facade =
True, *all* business logic using the object must also switch to new
facade in the same step, which is a pain and sometimes close to
impossible to do without changing thousands loosely related lines of
code in multiple modules. It would be nice to instead use objects as
usual in different contexts - some using engine facade and some still
using session.begin(...) - and allow the OVO framework to pick the right
way to nest subtransactions.

This patch does exactly that. We call an internal function from oslo.db
and check whether it raises an exception. If it does, it means that the
engine facade is not used; otherwise, we use the new style of nested
transactions management.

By default, if session is not active when OVO action is called, we stick
to the old facade. Once we are done with switching the rest of the
plugin code / OVO objects to the new facade, we will rip off the
transitionary logic.

Change-Id: Ia05df925eccf3c9d397748f282e995203a058de9
Partially-Implements: blueprint enginefacade-switch
Partially-Implements: blueprint adopt-oslo-versioned-objects-for-db
(cherry picked from commit 92b95815318806f90eca987145ad453782dd7041)

[{'created': '2020-09-23 01:42:53.000000000', 'message': 'Switch from unittest2 compat methods to Python 3.x methods

With the removal of Python 2.x we can remove the unittest2 compat
wrappers and switch to assertCountEqual instead of assertItemsEqual

We have been able to use them since then, because
testtools required unittest2, which still included it. With testtools
removing Python 2.7 support [3][4], we will lose support for
assertItemsEqual, so we should switch to use assertCountEqual.

'}]
commit_message:
Switch from unittest2 compat methods to Python 3.x methods

With the removal of Python 2.x we can remove the unittest2 compat
wrappers and switch to assertCountEqual instead of assertItemsEqual

We have been able to use them since then, because
testtools required unittest2, which still included it. With testtools
removing Python 2.7 support [3][4], we will lose support for
assertItemsEqual, so we should switch to use assertCountEqual.

[1] - https://bugs.python.org/issue17866
[2] - https://hg.python.org/cpython/rev/d9921cb6e3cd
[3] - testing-cabal/testtools#286
[4] - testing-cabal/testtools#277

Change-Id: I2fa17822ffaa5c87397ad6840c962e9308c95d6a

By default, when creating logical routers in ovn, ovn-northd creates

commit_message:
[OVN] disable neighour learning from ARP requests for routers

By default, when creating logical routers in ovn, ovn-northd creates
logical flows to handle arp-related traffic. This scales poorly with
a number of logical routers connected to the same network though,
with 800 routers resulting in over 640k entries in lr_in_ip_input table.

This patch sets two options on each created routers to limit a number
of logical flows created in that table.

Closes-Bug: #1897095
Change-Id: I9572f91281a719230749fd1222ae96e9e06b4dc6

commit_message:
Support SR-IOV in OVN migration infrared plugin

This patch adds SR-IOV support to OVN migration plugin.
This includes necessary changes in overcloud deploy templates
and ability to create SR-IOV resources.

Change-Id: I5074601605c67be6aada232e42ba94de6c60e56e
Closes-bug: #1899009

[{'created': '2020-09-22 10:39:34.000000000', 'message': 'Fix bug for updating external_port of floating IP port forwarding rule

When an existed port forwarding rule is updating on the floating IP,
if the external_port field which contained in the updated content is the same
as that in other port forwarding rule entries under the floating IP, Neutron
should grab the problem and return 400.

Change-Id: I4f9e73c157807049a713f6cc5ba784bc671247b2
Closes-Bug: #1896563
'}]
commit_message:
Fix bug for updating external_port of floating IP port forwarding rule

When an existed port forwarding rule is updating on the floating IP,
if the external_port field which contained in the updated content is the same
as that in other port forwarding rule entries under the floating IP, Neutron
should grab the problem and return 400.

Change-Id: I4f9e73c157807049a713f6cc5ba784bc671247b2
Closes-Bug: #1896563

commit_message:
[OVN] Gate on the released version of OVN for the multinode job

This patch is adding a OVN multinode job with a released version of OVS
in the queue and moving the one based on the master branch of OVS/OVN to
the experimental gate (since those are unstable by nature).

Change-Id: I5e16bab288d47d5ce01ddcc644b5e92e50bedd72
Signed-off-by: Lucas Alvares Gomes <lucasagomes@gmail.com>

commit_message:
Fix bug for updating floating IP port forwarding rule IP and port mismatch update success.

When we update forwarding rules of floating IP,
if updated floating IP port forwarding rule internal_ Ip_ Address and internal_ port_ ID mismatch,
we can update success, that is a problem

Change-Id: I38dd0d0640ae7a8469291fbac2139bab45cdd5c2
Closes-Bug: #1896571

Revert "[Fullstack] Mark security groups test as unstable"

This reverts commit e748e01656e6d2db1510d85e4c25e21ff394c971.

> based on this PoC: https://review.opendev.org/731396

Thanks Lajos for starting in neutron. One thing to note is that adding extra plugins can be backword incompatible change for existing users. Once the healthcheck endpoint is released (In V cycle) then, adding more checks might be risky but depends on how we consider that as API change or extend/improve the checks internally even detailed response change ?. 

But one recommendation is to brainstorm all the required checks and add them together. 

Anyways all these are still open question and we will be disucssin it in nova PTG. - https://etherpad.opendev.org/p/nova-victoria-ptg'}, {'account_id': 1131, 'date': '2020-05-29 19:49:00.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

I think what is important here is to check this from 

* operators (like response time, what happens if i.e. haproxy like services start polling this or similar) 

* and security perspective (like what we can show on this API endpoint, do we need auth on this, or on part of this API?)

I think it is good to see the discussion on the similar patch for nova: https://review.opendev.org/731396'}, {'account_id': 26622, 'date': '2020-06-05 13:24:04.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3:

[{'created': '2020-09-15 21:13:18.000000000', 'message': 'Set process name for agents

Now that we use setproctitle for neutron-server workers (and
neutron-keepalived-state-change), this has the side effect of changing
the process name for agents, impacting some monitoring systems. More
details in launchpad bug.

This patch fixes it by setting the name with setproctitle to:
agent name (original process name).

Also use the newly introduced name constants to replace existing
hardcoded uses.

Change-Id: I74c3a4d3e9f833752571a75f196560cd45529385
Closes-Bug: #1881297
(cherry picked from commit 5ce0595803e72157a82f086b520f454786100872)

commit_message:
Set process name for agents

Now that we use setproctitle for neutron-server workers (and
neutron-keepalived-state-change), this has the side effect of changing
the process name for agents, impacting some monitoring systems. More
details in launchpad bug.

This patch fixes it by setting the name with setproctitle to:
agent name (original process name).

Also use the newly introduced name constants to replace existing
hardcoded uses.

Change-Id: I74c3a4d3e9f833752571a75f196560cd45529385
Closes-Bug: #1881297
(cherry picked from commit 5ce0595803e72157a82f086b520f454786100872)

Add ML2/OVS and OVN jobs that set TUNNEL_IP_VERSION=6
to verify they can run over IPv6 tunnel endpoints.

NOTE: If these work, it might be best to just roll this
config into the base tempest IPv6-only jobs?  Or just
set by default in the neutron jobs?

Change-Id: I30fe98526bc9c56b30637bd983c9e6ff0fdf5bc9
Depends-on: https://review.opendev.org/#/c/710519/
'}]
commit_message:
WIP: Add IPv6-only tunnel jobs

Add ML2/OVS and OVN jobs that set TUNNEL_IP_VERSION=6
to verify they can run over IPv6 tunnel endpoints.

NOTE: If these work, it might be best to just roll this
config into the base tempest IPv6-only jobs?  Or just
set by default in the neutron jobs?

Change-Id: I30fe98526bc9c56b30637bd983c9e6ff0fdf5bc9
Depends-on: https://review.opendev.org/#/c/710519/

commit_message:
Drop old port when the ovs_use_veth changes.

The ovs_use_veth parameter does not take effet for existing ovs
interfaces. For example, the qr-dev interface already exists in
the qrouter namespace, when change the ovs_use_veth from false
to true, the veth interface can't be created. So need to add the
_drop_old_port() to drop old port when the ovs_use_veth changes.

Change-Id: I3eeae671e6ab1b24aadfa20b10d13556bdb1b1ac
Closes-Bug: #1894799

commit_message:
Remove references to "tenant_id" from api.v2.base.Controller

The migration from "tenant_id" to "project_id" finised in Ocata,
but "tenant_id" is still present in many places in the code. This
patch removes this reference from the API Controller class.

Change-Id: I3b4ddc9c05281930c96bdc970de84cce9f857b79
Closes-Bug: #1858783

(1 comment)'}, {'account_id': 10962, 'date': '2019-01-25 17:30:13.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 5:

Slawek, yes we have kept this review as a WIP. Reason why is that if someone updates neutron to master after this merges (in its current form), it will break networking on those using routed networks.

Earlier in this review I mentioned some TODOs, but I'll restate them now:
* Need to add code to handle ensuring bridges are also updated/deleted using the segment_id (rather than network_id)
* Need to add something (a feature flag?) that prevents this from breaking networking when someone updates to master.
* Need to create migration code that will convert existing bridges from network_id based to segment_id based (ideally live or with little network traffic downtime). Once converted, the feature flag could enable the feature and start using the new code.

We would be very welcome to suggestions/tips/examples on how to make any of the above a reality."}, {'account_id': 11975, 'date': '2019-01-28 20:53:52.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 5:

> Slawek, yes we have kept this review as a WIP. Reason why is that
 > if someone updates neutron to master after this merges (in its
 > current form), it will break networking on those using routed
 > networks.
 > 
 > Earlier in this review I mentioned some TODOs, but I'll restate
 > them now:
 > * Need to add code to handle ensuring bridges are also
 > updated/deleted using the segment_id (rather than network_id)
 > * Need to add something (a feature flag?) that prevents this from
 > breaking networking when someone updates to master.
 > * Need to create migration code that will convert existing bridges
 > from network_id based to segment_id based (ideally live or with
 > little network traffic downtime). Once converted, the feature flag
 > could enable the feature and start using the new code.
 > 
 > We would be very welcome to suggestions/tips/examples on how to
 > make any of the above a reality.

IMO migration tool which would run during agent restart would be the best idea. Also it is IMO perfect example of patch where upgrade-checker CLI tool can be used. You can wrote check function which will check in DB if routed networks are used in current deployment or not, and if there are such networks, warn operator that there will be data plane interruption during upgrade of agents."}, {'account_id': 10962, 'date': '2019-02-19 00:23:55.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 6.'}, {'account_id': 26622, 'date': '2019-02-19 02:00:41.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 6:

For rechecking only on the Cloudbase Neutron Hyper-V CI, add a review comment with run-Cloudbase Neutron Hyper-V CI

Have added some migration notes into the associated bug here: https://bugs.launchpad.net/neutron/+bug/1764738/comments/13

It outlines a plan for how we migrated a cloud to have this multi-segment per host feature without breaking the network. It also incurs minimal downtime. Would like to discuss this in the Denver PTG sessions.'}, {'account_id': 8313, 'date': '2019-05-03 15:05:23.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 10:

Hi, there are some problems in supporting routed networks from nova side (perhaps adding the placement aggregate to the placement query from nova before scheduling) but they decided to fix that now:
https://review.opendev.org/656885

Perhaps keep an eye on that as well and contact Matt about it'}, {'account_id': 10962, 'date': '2019-06-10 23:31:43.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 10:

Dear reviewers,

Would like your opinions on the following code: https://github.com/openstack/neutron/blob/cbee0f9f88ff34f70ff19590471b5405e06ff2a9/neutron/plugins/ml2/drivers/agent/_agent_manager_base.py#L62-L68

What I dont like about it:
* It's called add_network, but it really adds a segment object (me confused).
* The backing `self.network_map` can only support one network per segment (key=network_id, value=one segment). If you add another segment for the same network, it overwrites the previous segment.

I have three options to approach this:
* Option-1: change method from `add_networks` into add_segments. Backing self.segments would be a list or set.
* Option-2: keep it as `add_networks` but change `self.network_map` where key=network_id, value=list_or_set
* Option-3: create `add_networks` and do all the work same as Option-1 and deprecate `add_networks` but somehow adapt it to push its data into Option-1 backing self.segments.

Pros/Cons:
* Option-1 breaks interfaces and potentially agent/stadium code that may use it. But... it represents what we are actually adding: segments.
* Option-2 breaks much less and provides for a more frictionless transition. But still confusing when we're adding a segment object when calling add_network.
* Option-3 Can only really be viable if Option-1 works and we are able to somehow adapt deprecated `add_networks`. Would not be able to even try until Opt1 works.

Without any feedback, I'm going to work towards Option-1.

However, I'd like: Thoughts? Opinions? Questions? Concerns?"}, {'account_id': 10962, 'date': '2019-06-11 22:54:09.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 11.'}, {'account_id': 26622, 'date': '2019-06-12 00:29:34.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 11:

Build succeeded.

- neutron http://cloudbase-ci.com/neutron/623115/11 : SUCCESS in 1h 34m 46s'}, {'account_id': 13995, 'date': '2019-06-12 15:29:22.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 11:

> Without any feedback, I'm going to work towards Option-1.
 > 
 > However, I'd like: Thoughts? Opinions? Questions? Concerns?

It may or may not be the cleanest solution, but I think what I would do is a modified option 3 where you leave add_network as just a shim calling add_segment, and then we can remove dependencies to add_network as a subsequent action.

And I'd call it network_segment_map not network_map.  Just my $0.02.


    def add_segment(self, network_id, network_segment):
        """Add a network segment to the agent internal network segment list
        :param network_id: The UUID of the network
        :param network_segment: The NetworkSegment object for this network
        """
self.network_segment_map[network_id] = network_segment

    def add_network(self, network_id, network_segment):
        """Maintained for compatibility, but that is being done here is adding a segment not a network so we will migrate away from calling it add_network.
        """
        # TODO(dbingham): Find stadium projects that depend on add_network and migrate them to add_segment
self.add_segment(network_id, network_segment)'}, {'account_id': 16688, 'date': '2019-06-12 17:42:46.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 11:

commit_message:
[WIP] Allow multiple segments to same host on routed networks

Allows multiple segments of a routed network to be bound to the same
host. This allows deployers to create multiple segments on a routed
network, attach multiple segments to the same host and correctly
be able to deploy VMs from it.

Changes:
Patches 1-6: Core changes
Patch 7: Add Alembic migration to backfill segment_id bridge_name
Patch 8: Fixes for alembic migration. Fix plugin comment.
Patch 9: Rebase
Patch 10: Rebase + fix bug in get_vif_details to always set bridge_name
Patch 11: Rebase

Change-Id: Ibcc90e9d25f863e8577e4092fef786c25755f35a
Closes-Bug: 1764738
Co-Authored-By: Kris Lindgren <klindgren@godaddy.com>

to send garp, this works, but each time the send_garp function called, there

commit_message:
neutron-keepalived-state-change file descriptor leak

the commit 21935365f2 fix the neutron-keepalived-state-change script by replace
the eventlet to threading, now the script use threading + eventlet.green.subprocess
to send garp, this works, but each time the send_garp function called, there
is a file left in /proc/<pid of neutron-keepalived-state-change>/fd, this cause
the file descriptor leak, and then cause the script to consume huge memory until
kernel OOM.

Closes-Bug: #1907411
Change-Id: I74ec64bcaae3ec104b4833d36d547ac7e1b9c159

commit_message:
Enable querier for multicast (IGMP) in OVN

This patch is adding IGMP querier support in the OVN driver.
IGMP querier is working only when IGMP snooping is enable.

Depends-On: https://review.opendev.org/762818
Change-Id: I0b9e1c0b7cf467c6c507102cd1fae72b68be90cc

commit_message:
Add tenant_id check when listing security groups

When listing security groups, even if the 'tenant_id' does not exist,
the default security group for the tenant will be generated. This patch
calls keystone to verify whether the 'tenant_id' exists.

Closes-Bug: #1912747
Change-Id: Iffc08096ccfee5a2e6899ad652d4cc27cc8c885b

commit_message:
Fix update port sgs without specifing "device_owner" attr bug

When update a port of which device_owner startswith 'network:'
with security_groups attribute, the port can be successfully
updated. On the contrary，those network device owner ports
should not be added security_groups.

Change-Id: I4203834d502298e325eedefc71a2d77e8f41ea50
Closes-Bug: #1859765

commit_message:
Limit number of the test workers used in functional tests job

To limit resource usage and to avoid killing MySQL server by
the oom-killer, let's limit number of test workers from 8 to 4
in the functional tests CI job.

Change-Id: Ic4b1dad3184fe2e2c541a3f3442f0b78dab87db6
